The material contained in this email may be confidential, and may also be the subject of copyright and/or privileged information. If you are not the intended recipient, please delete it. Internet communications are not secure and accordingly Maker's Mark Creative does not accept any legal liability for the contents or damage caused by this message.

Hi Jamie, 

We looked into this for you. Joel found an article here: https://coderwall.com/p/hynjha/widget-title-on-before_widget-tag-class which may give  you some insights that you can apply. 

If you need us to jump in and tackle it, by all means, let us know?
@joel I forgot to ask you to look into this one? Did you have a chance to? Cheers

Thanks Heath!


Kind regards,

Jamie Shek
Director, Maker's Mark Creative

// M 0423 592 912
// E jamie@makersmarkcreative.com.au
// in linkedin.com/in/jamieshek

Hi Jamie, 

Sure we will look at it early afternoon - cheers

Hi Heath,

Thanks for that, I think the smartest way would be to keep the shortcode clean and the plugin hack free. Leave it with me for now.

If you don't mind keeping the clock running I have a something else I need help with… Would you mind looking out how I can pass the widget title into my widgets 'before_widget' <h3> where it's highlighted in red?


// Footer
register_sidebar( array(
'name' => esc_html__( 'Footer 4', 'wp-bootstrap-starter' ),
'id' => 'footer-4',
'description' => esc_html__( 'Add widgets here.', 'wp-bootstrap-starter' ),
'before_widget' => '<h3 class="widget-title d-block d-sm-none"><a data-toggle="collapse" href="#collapseFooter4" role="button" aria-expanded="false" aria-controls="collapseFooter4">TITLE</a></h3><section id="%1$s" class="widget %2$s collapse dont-collapse-sm">',
'after_widget' => '</section>',
'before_title' => '<h3 class="widget-title d-none d-sm-block">',
'after_title' => '</h3>',
) );


Let me know if you can have a look at that today, and once again thanks for your support!


Kind regards,

Jamie Shek
Director, Maker's Mark Creative

// M 0423 592 912
// E jamie@makersmarkcreative.com.au
// in linkedin.com/in/jamieshek
Also, here is a link where Joel inputed the shortcode: https://staging.redrockgroup.com.au/wp-admin/post.php?post=6906&action=edit as detailed below.

Hi Jamie, 

Sure, Joel had a look at this for you. You should be able to achieve it by adding some attributes to the short code that was used. 

Current:
[downloads category=franchise-portal-calculators-and-tools]

Suggested: 
[downloads category=franchise-portal-calculators-and-tools loop_start='<table><thead><tr><th>File Name</th><th width="140px">Version</th><th width="140px">File Date</th><th width="140px">Date Modified</th></tr></thead>' loop_end='</table>' before='<tr>' after=</tr>]

The only challenge with this method is that the shortcode would need to be updated on each page. You could potentially use the 'Search and Replace' function in the Kinsta dashboard for this. (Do a dry run first). 

IF you need it to be applied automatically to the shortcode let us know and we can look deeper into it. I.e. a solution to do this without hacking the plugin.

@heath 

[downloads category=franchise-portal-calculators-and-tools]

[downloads category=franchise-portal-calculators-and-tools loop_start='<table><thead><tr><th>File Name</th><th width="140px">Version</th><th width="140px">File Date</th><th width="140px">Date Modified</th></tr></thead>' loop_end='</table>' before='<tr>' after=</tr>]

Oh, while you guys are looking - did you have any thoughts on how to mod the plugin with a hook?

Highlight in red is what I had changed on the following file: plugins⁩ ▸ ⁨download-monitor-rr-mod⁩ ▸ ⁨src⁩⁩ ▸ ⁨Shortcodes.php



public function downloads( $atts ) {
global $dlm_max_num_pages;

extract( shortcode_atts( array(
// Query args
'per_page' => '-1', // -1 = no limit
'orderby' => 'title', // title, rand, ID, none, date, modifed, post__in, download_count
'order' => 'asc', // ASC or DESC
'include' => '', // Comma separate IDS
'exclude' => '', // Comma separate IDS
'offset' => '',
'category' => '', // Comma separate slugs
'category_include_children' => true, // Set to false to not include child categories
'tag' => '', // Comma separate slugs
'exclude_tag' => '', // Comma separate slugs
'featured' => false, // Set to true to only pull featured downloads
'members_only' => false, // Set to true to only pull member downloads

// Output args
'template' => dlm_get_default_download_template(),
'loop_start' => '

<table class="table table-striped table-hover dlm-downloads">
<thead>
<tr><th>File Name</th>
<th width="140px">Version</th>
<th width="140px">File Date</th>
<th width="140px">Date Modified</th>
</tr>
</thead>',
'loop_end' => '</table>',
'before' => '<tr>',
'after' => '</tr>',
'paginate' => false
), $atts ) );


What do you think?


Kind regards,

Jamie Shek
Director, Maker's Mark Creative

// M 0423 592 912
// E jamie@makersmarkcreative.com.au
// in linkedin.com/in/jamieshek

Hi Heath,

action.text: Heath Maguire assigned to Joel Maligalig

full_threads.body:
Hi Jamie, 

We do need WP access and the token link below has expired can you please reset it again? Or if you like we can create ourselves one through the db.

Hi Heath,

Amazing, thanks!

FYI, you can have a look at the docs but there’s no support to pull the date modified - I got an email back from the plugin developers saying:

> Please check https://www.download-monitor.com/kb/shortcode-download_data/ <https://www.download-monitor.com/kb/shortcode-download_data/>. We do offer a way to get the file date but no modified date. You would need additional custom code which is beyond the scope of our support. I would recommend contacting other developers like "Codeable <http://never5.com/codeable>" who would be able to work with you to create a custom solution for this.

I’m not sure if file date changes when the post has been updated because I’ve been unsuccessful in pulling that into the template. Maybe it’s worth trying to get that working first. What do you think?

Here’s ftp access - the site is hosted on Kinsta:

https://app.teamsid.com/passwords/shared/dkt07w156huPV6kdOy6Wia/07f900b306bdd9a2adf5575fb179c60f365263c1 <https://app.teamsid.com/passwords/shared/dkt07w156huPV6kdOy6Wia/07f900b306bdd9a2adf5575fb179c60f365263c1>

Here’a a sample page you can work with: https://staging.redrockgroup.com.au/franchise/franchise-portal/download-monitor-testing-page/ <https://staging.redrockgroup.com.au/franchise/franchise-portal/download-monitor-testing-page/>

Here’s a Wordpress user account you can login with if you need but I doubt you will.
https://app.teamsid.com/passwords/shared/p61gYuVEQbPCCin2Rp3w2z/b3c1f82142f186db3a1547b8858cc1a9f793b98d <https://app.teamsid.com/passwords/shared/p61gYuVEQbPCCin2Rp3w2z/b3c1f82142f186db3a1547b8858cc1a9f793b98d>

Currently, the date modified table is showing the pages modified date rather than the downloads modified date.

There template override file lives in the child theme here: ⁨themes⁩ ▸ ⁨wp-bootstrap-starter-child-red-rock⁩ ▸ ⁨download-monitor ▸ ⁨content-download.php

The plugin lives here, it’s a copy: ⁨plugins⁩ ▸ ⁨download-monitor-rr-mod⁩

There’s one other file I’ve modified directly in the plugin (I couldn’t work out how to make a change to that file using a hook or filter). Basically all I did there was alter the html output. Maybe you can have a look and let me know if there’s a better way so I’m not altering the plugin files. I’ve made a copy of the plugin. The file I’ve altered is here: plugins⁩ ▸ ⁨download-monitor-rr-mod⁩ ▸ ⁨src⁩⁩ ▸ ⁨Shortcodes.php

Once you’ve had a read of this email give me a buzz and I’ll run you through the changes I’ve made 😀

Let me know if you’ve have to spend more than an hours on this - Hopefully with your expertise you’ll work it out pretty quickly.

Thanks!

Kind regards,

Jamie Shek
Director, Maker’s Mark Creative

// M 0423 592 912
// E jamie@makersmarkcreative.com.au <mailto:jamie@makersmarkcreative.com.au>
// in linkedin.com/in/jamieshek <http://linkedin.com/in/jamieshek>

>>

>>
>> Naturally it displays a list of Custom post called Downloads. I’ve been modifying the front end to display in a tabled format.

>>

>>
